direction.raw_text: through the darkness. 228-I   INT. SUBWAY CAR - PETER AND SHERMAN - LATE AFTERNOON           228-I* as the car slows down.     Sherman is slightly drunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The car stops. Sherman steps onto the platform.        Peter remains in the car. Sherman looks back at him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ... and then this newspaper thing started, this Peter Fallow person, and all the facts were wrong, total disregard for the truth. Why do they do this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is you. You'll be right on Lexington Avenue.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They call me by my first name. Like they know me. Like they own me. Newspapers, lawyers, police, people I don't even know. How did I get to be so important?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're not important. You're just dinner. You know what I mean? And a week from now, a month -- nobody is even going to remember what they ate.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I should have called the police right away, when it happened. But I couldn't you see? It wasn't really my decision.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How do you mean?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I mean, I wasn't driving the car.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?! (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - Rev. 4/18/90                   94. 228-I   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The doors to the train start to close.     Peter tries to stop them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as the doors close and the train pulls away. 229     EXT. PARK AVENUE - DEMONSTRATORS - NIGHT                       229 are marching up and down in front of Sherman's apartment building. Among them are five very tall black men play- ing with a basketball. 230     ANGLE - SHERMAN                                                230 stops near the building. The basketball flies toward him. He catches it. Before anyone sees him, he enters through the service entrance. 231     OMITTED                                                        231 232     INT. ELEVATOR - SHERMAN - NIGHT                                232 looks like he feels -- unclean, unshaven, slightly drunk, his clothes soiled, torn and disheveled. He seems to stoop slightly under the weight of his humiliation. 233     ANGLE - ELEVATOR DOORS                                         233 open and suddenly we are in the midst of... 234     ANGLE - PARTY                                                  234 in high gear. Most of the guests are recognizable from the previous party at the museum. Sherman is shocked. But before he can get his bearings...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all turn and applaud.    As Sherman moves through                * them...                                                               * *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 4/18/90                 95.         * 234   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fruit flies. That's all they are. They swarm. They hover over the faces. You take a swipe at them, they run away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. But they always come back to the shit. Don't they?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I always thought of you as such a dull person.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sherman, has anybody talked to you about television?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh... no.    What?                                    *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'd have to play down the racial thing and try to make you a little more sympathetic. You know, sympathetic. *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me... 235   ANGLE - RAWLIE THORPE                                        235 approaches Sherman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sherman.    Gee. Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rawlie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. I didn't mean to interrupt anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.   No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gene asked me to come by...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. I haven't really been able to talk to anybody. (CONTINUED) BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 4/18/90                     96. 235   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He just wanted you to know, anything we can do...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, well. I should be down there in a day or so...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, that won't be necessary. That's what I came to... I was sent to tell you. I mean, you don't have to... I mean, you shouldn't come down. I mean, they don't want you to come down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.    I see.    Well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus,  Sherman. I'm sorry. But between  all this and the way you handled  Bernard on the Giscard deal.                     * I mean,  six hundred million...                           *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's final, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, the firm feels...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.    Yes.    Of course.   Excuse me. FOLLOW him INTO... 236   INT. KITCHEN - SHERMAN                                           236 finds Judy and Bonita putting dinner together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Judy.   What is going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a dinner party. It was planned weeks ago. If you ever bothered to look at your calendar...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Judy, I mean, under the circumstances... (CONTINUED) BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 4/18/90                     97/98. 236   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. I know the whole story.     I heard it -- saw it all on television. On television?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.   I am. Believe me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You betrayed us, Sherman. Me. Campbell. Even yourself. On the                          * other hand, I am going to chair                          * the museum benefit thanks to you                         * and your escapades on the public                         * airways. What can I say? Life                            * goes on. I can only make the best                        * of an absolutely appalling situation and carry on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But can you forgive me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I suppose I can forgive   anything, but not television. I'm    leaving                       * you, Sherman. After the    party.                        * Now if you'll excuse me,   we have                       * guests. She leaves. 237   ANGLE - TO INCLUDE SALLY RAWTHROTE                              237 as she sails into the kitchen, she sees Judy leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, my darling, is this a bad time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I beg your pardon...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What am I saying? Of course it's a bad time. But I just wanted to see if I can be of any help. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 237   CONTINUED:                                                    237 SHERMAN Well, that's very kind of you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know I haven't been in this apartment since the McCleods had it. That was before the Kittridges. I hope I'm not being out of place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not at all... uh...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sally.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anyway, thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, really, anything I can do. With the apartment, is what I mean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The apartment?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I find people often need to be as liquid as they can in these situations and I know I can get you seven-and-a-half right at this moment. Fabled aristocratic tycoon -- it's the celebrity appeal. Maybe eight. If we act quickly this kind of opportunity doesn't come along every day. You have to ride the wave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me.   I have to... uh... Excuse me. 238   INT. LIVING ROOM - SHERMAN                                    238 comes out of the kitchen. As he tries to make his way through the living room, trying to avoid the guests... 239   ANGLE - POLLARD BROWNING                                      239 intercepting Sherman.     Sherman keeps walking.   Pollard follows. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 239   CONTINUED:                                                    239 SHERMAN Pollard.   How are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry to interrupt your dinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not at all.   The more the merrier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been in touch with the co-op board, well, most of them, and we want you to know you have our support.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, at first I wanted to die. Standing there in court, people calling my name...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.   Of course. Hard to believe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then I thought, I have a gun. Twelve gauge. Double barrel... FOLLOW them INTO... 240   INT. STUDY - SHERMAN                                       240 goes to the closet and pulls out the shotgun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sherman, we've known each other a long time. We went to Buckley together. My father knew your father. I speak as a friend. But also as president of the board. Is that a gun?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wonder if I can get both barrels into my mouth. That's what I was thinking. And how do you pull the trigger. I read somewhere about a man who took off his shoe and pulled the trigger with his toe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. This can't be a comfortable situation for you. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 240   CONTINUED:                                                      240 SHERMAN And where would I do it?   Who would find me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly. Yes. Have you considered... changing residence until things quiet down?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want me to leave?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is my home...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I understand that...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the only safe place I have. People are threatening my life. I have to protect myself. He loads the gun and fills his pockets with shells.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are people demonstrating in front of our building. Black people with basketballs! You're putting everyone at risk. It's not your fault. But that doesn't alter the facts. FOLLOW Sherman and Pollard OUT of the study TO... 241   INT. LIVING ROOM - SHERMAN AND POLLARD                        241 SHERMAN Alter the facts?! The facts are that I have no place else to go! And you want me to move out?! Is that what you're saying, Pollard. You want me to move out of my home?! The guests begin to listen to this exchange.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are a shareholder in a cooperative. Look, we're not asking you to do anything of a permanent nature... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 241   CONTINUED:                                                      241 SHERMAN Why don't you move out, Pollard? If you're so fucking terrified!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sherman, please...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you can start by moving out of this apartment right now. Out! Now! Sherman points the gun at Pollard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I came here in good faith.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Pollard, you were a ridiculous fat blowhard at Buckley and you're a ridiculous fat blowhard now. Everyone watches as Sherman holds Pollard at gunpoint and steers him out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will have to enforce the provision concerning unacceptable situations.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another word out of you, Pollard, and there's going to be an unacceptable situation right up                          * your ass! Now march!                                     * The guests applaud.    Sherman turns to face them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that goes for the rest of you, too. Out. All of you. The guests look confused, they don't really believe him. Sherman aims the GUN at the ceiling. He FIRES. EXPLOSION. People scream. 242   ANGLE - SHERMAN                                               242 waves the smoking shotgun at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out! Stinking lot of anorexic parasites. Get out of my house! (CONTINUED) BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 4/18/90                      103. 242    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He FIRES another SHOT. The room clears.        Judy comes running from the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The DOG comes BARKING into the room.     Campbell follows., Judy grabs her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sherman reloads and keeps FIRING until everyone is gone. LAMPS EXPLODE, furniture splinters, plaster falls.                                                                    *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LEICESTER'S - CLOSE ON PETER - NIGHT                          248 who looks very depressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: PULL BACK to include Peter surrounded by fawning packs of well-wishers, including Gerald Moore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 4/18/90                 104. 248   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beautiful stuff, Peter.   First rate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks like a real killer, this                      * McCoy fellow. Doesn't he?                              *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can see it in the photographs. You can see it in his chin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arrogant son a bitch, isn't he? I hope they throw the book at him. Evelyn Moore approaches Gerald.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daddy.    Dinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, darling. Shall we have Peter here come along with us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lovely. Gerald and Evelyn lead Peter toward the back dining room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to give this story our full attention, Peter. It makes us look better and better, the more we do for this Lamb family. Poor little Lambs, poor little fuzzy-wuzzy wogs. Caroline Heftshank intercepts them.     She is very drunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, Peter. There's a phone call for you upstairs in the office. Peter makes excuses to Gerald and Evelyn and follows Caroline away. 249   OMITTED                                                       249 250   INT. UPSTAIRS OFFICE - PETER AND CAROLINE - NIGHT             250 come into the office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's the phone? (CONTINUED) BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 4/18/90                   105. 250   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I lied. I wanted to see you alone. I'm going to do you a favor.                             *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't tell me I'm finally going to get into your panties.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't deserve this, Peter. But I'm going to tell you something.                         * * She reaches under her skirt and pulls off her panties. She drops them on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, Caroline. I'm sort of with some people tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Relax, darling. Do you remember my pretty little Italian friend? The painter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Yes, I do. Franco or Federico...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Filippo.   The little shit. Caroline climbs up on the desk, lifts her skirt and sits down on the Xerox machine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Caroline, you're absolutely soused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Filippo has run off with a little slut you should know about.                     * She switches ON the MACHINE, which starts PHOTOCOPYING her twat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Caroline, isn't that dangerous? Or at least unsanitary?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up, Peter. You're not listening. Her name is Maria Ruskin. (MORE) (CONTINUED) BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 4/18/90                   106.         * 250   CONTINUED:    (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was subletting my apartment. She was also subletting Filippo. And, as it turns out, she was also in the car with Sherman McCoy when the accident happened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're joking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never joke.    She was in the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But how do you know all this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The apartment was bugged. They had a wire in the intercom. They were trying to prove that I wasn't living there. Which I wasn't. Now I've lost the apartment and the boyfriend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't know where they are?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. But I'm trusting you to find them. And when you do. Give them this. Tell them this is the little lady who turned them in. She takes one of the Xerox copies and hands it to Peter. Peter leaves. Caroline looks at the Xerox copy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe I should advertise... 251   OMITTED                                                         251 252   INT. RESTAURANT - MAITRE D' - DAY                               252 points Fallow toward Arthur Ruskin's table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Monsieur Ruskin is already here. 253   ANGLE - ARTHUR RUSKIN                                           253 seated at a table as Peter approaches. The Maitre d' seats them side by side on a banquette. (CONTINUED) BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 4/18/90                  107.         * 253   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur. Thanks for meeting me on such short notice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peter Fallow?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. We've never met but I'm a good friend of... your wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My wife! My wife! I'm glad she's not here. Otherwise I couldn't have a drink. (to waiter) Give me a Couvoisier V.S.O.P. No. Put it in a sidecar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.   Uh... where is Maria, by the way?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Italy. Every time I turn around, she's in Italy. I'm not supposed to drink. But I love a sidecar. It was Willi Nordhoff introduced me to them. So. You're on the City Light?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, yes. And we're doing a little profile piece. We're calling it the 'New Tycoons.' And, naturally, we thought of you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. Good. I like that. New tycoons. So what do you want to know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, there's no hurry. So Maria is in Italy. Where abouts?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's in Lake Como someplace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, there are some great hotels in Lake Como. Is she at the Excelsior? (CONTINUED) BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 4/18/90                 107A. 253   CONTINUED:    (1A)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do I know? I just pay the                       * bills. Well, she's young. She needs young people. I'm not stupid. I know what goes on. We should order. I don't have too much time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like to talk to her, too. If I could. If I could get in                        * touch with her...                                    * (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 253   CONTINUED:    (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Call the office. I'll give you her number. She's something. I always said it as a compliment, but she's a lot of pussy to handle. Excuse my language. What do you want to eat? 254   ANGLE - WAITERS - LATER                                     254 are bringing the main course to the table. Arthur is guzzling wine as he talks. Peter is bored silly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... But the best is just a few weeks ago, one of these jackass pilots, he lands long and the plane goes off the runway. I was there. I was on the plane. We're going into Mecca, see. And the plane is full of Arabs and all these animals -- sheep, goats, chickens. They won't travel without their animals. We had to put plastic in the cabins. You know, they urinate, they defecate...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anyway, the plane goes off the runway and we hit the sand with a hell of a jolt and the right wing tip digs into the sand and the plane skids around in a circle!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: degrees before we stop! We're scared shitless. Panic. And we look into the cabin and there's everybody calm, quiet, they're picking up their luggage and their animals and they're looking out the window at the little fire that started on the wing and they're waiting for the doors to open like nothing happened. And then it dawns on me. They think this is normal! He starts to laugh as he talks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They think this is the way you stop an airplane. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 254   CONTINUED:                                                      254 ARTHUR (CONT'D) You stick one wing in the sand and you spin around until you stop. (coughing as he laughs harder and harder) What do they know? They never rode in an airplane. They think this is how you do it! Peter tries to laugh with Arthur. But Arthur's coughing turns into a spasm. He pushes his head back against the banquette. He seems to be humming. And then his head drops forward and he slumps against Peter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur?   Arthur? He tries to signal a waiter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me.   Hello? Excuse me. Waiter!!! The Maitre d' approaches the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Ruskin seems to have suffered some kind of -- well, I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, dear. Oh, dear. Oh, dear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you'd better call someone. Arthur drops forward suddenly, his face hitting his plate. A woman at the next table squeals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Freddy? Attention, s'il vous plait! Two waiters   help the Maitre d' pull the table out. Arthur slips   off his plate and falls onto the floor. Some people   notice. But, in general, the activity in the room   continues. The Maitre d' gives orders to the waiters. A MAN approaches Peter. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 254   CONTINUED:    (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he choking? Let me give him the Heimlich maneuver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, Monsieur Roberts. You are not a doctor. And there are legal complications.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I see, but...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For your own protection and mine and my restaurant, we leave Monsieur Ruskin in the hands of God and we go back to our escargots.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, somebody has to do something. Peter tries to perform the Heimlich maneuver on Ruskin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have called the police. An ambulance is coming. There is nothing more we can do. Would you like some coffee or dessert?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gee, buddy. I think he's dead. Peter lets go of Ruskin.    Ruskin slides to the floor -- dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eh, voila.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: L'addition, s'il vous plait.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bill, monsieur. Thank you. And we do not accept credit cards. BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 4/18/90                 111. 255   EXT. AIRPORT - 747 - DUSK                                     255   * is landing. 256   INT. AIRPORT - MARIA - DUSK                                   256   * comes out of Customs.    She is wearing black and has a veil over her face. 257   ANGLE - FALLOW                                                257 approaches her.   They walk as they talk...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Ruskin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My name is Peter Fallow. I just wanted to offer my sympathy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How very kind. Did you know Arthur?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, well, yes. I was actually quite close to him when he died.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've reprobated myself over and over again for being away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You shouldn't. 258   EXT. TERMINAL - MARIA AND PETER - DUSK                        258   * move toward Maria's waiting limousine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, thank you for the kind words. I must go now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Just one other thing. I understand you're a friend of Sherman McCoy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry...? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .         * 258    CONTINUED:                                                     258 PETER Yes. I gather you were not only in the car with him when he had his unfortunate accident in the Bronx. But I understand you were driving. Maria turns and looks at him -- hard and cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She gets into the car.     Fallow watches the car pull away. He smiles. 259    OMITTED                                                        259 259A   EXT. HOSPITAL - NEWSSTAND - DAY                              259A The headline on the City Lights reads:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is lying in a coma -- a beatific smile on his face. 259C   ANGLE TO INCLUDE FOX, BACON, ANNIE LAMB AND PETER FALLOW 259C around the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 4/18/90                  113.          * 259C   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (tearfully) Please, you have to keep your voices down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gestures toward Henry Lamb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 4/18/90             114.          * 259C   CONTINUED:    (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly, Annie starts to weep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pause as they all look at her. )O(    BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 4/26/90                115. 260    CLOSE ON PETER                                               260 PETER (V.O.) How could I turn my back on the plight of this grief stricken woman? How could I turn my back on a 'profitable relationship'? I was touched to the depths of what was left of my soul... and my bank account. 260A   OMITTED                                                      260A thru                                                                thru 262A
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: * 262B   INT. WEISS'S OFFICE - CLOSE ON NEWSPAPER - DAY               262B The headline reads:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I printed their little story. Well, why not? Why not be the best whore in the house? And anyway, I was beginning to see even greater possibilities in my situation. * The shades are drawn; the room is dark. Weiss sits at his desk. Andriutti and Kramer are with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now they're going to sue the hospital. You see? All they want is money. Imagine using a terrible tragedy like this for your own selfish motives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir.   It is terrible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up, you asshole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir. (CONTINUED) )O(     BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 4/26/90                  116. 262B    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's happening to my case? The People versus Sherman McCoy? Where is my issue? Where is my cause? Where is my hope?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Kramer exits...

dialogue.raw_text: Wait a minute! Wait a minute! 228J    ANGLE - CLOSE ON PETER                                         228J
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: * Sherman! You sly fox. Great to see you. Everybody! It's                              * Sherman! Bravo! Bravo!                                   * *
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: * Sherman, my boy. Whatever you do, don't let the newspapers get you down. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Out of my house, out of my life!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: * Say goodbye to Daddy.                                        *
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: * 'Bye, Daddy.   See you later.                                *
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: * (as they go)                                          * You can see him on television.                               *
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sherman McCoy is dead. Sherman McCoy of Park Avenue and Wall Street and Southampton -- gone. Dead. I will never be Sherman McCoy again. Never! 242A   OMITTED                                                            242A thru                                                                      thru 247
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) That same evening, just a few blocks away, I was being praised and congratulated. It should have been a very triumphant yours truly at Leicester's. But it wasn't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) ... my little encounter with Sherman McCoy was spoiling everything. The truth has a way of doing that. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a lament)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (very disappointed)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (annoyed)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . ROBERTS
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . ROBERTS (to Peter)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (drops a card in front of Peter)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (through tears)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sherman would never tell you that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was hoping you might tell me exactly what happened that night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, Mr.... Mr....
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fallow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... Peckerhead. I am here for my husband's funeral. Understand? Now go away. Disappear. Disintegrate.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . HOSPITAL ROOM - HENRY LAMB - DAY                        259B
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: "FINANCIER'S WIDOW IS MCCOY MYSTERY WOMAN" 259B INT

dialogue.raw_text: What kind of muckracking yellow journalist are you!? You print a story like this without so much as a by-your-leave to me or to Reverend Bacon here! Who the hell do you think you are. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, don't you understand? It is very possible that Sherman McCoy was not driving that car. And I can almost prove it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So what?! So what?!   So what?! This is our case.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right here. You see? It's the hospital that's the guilty party.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The hospital?! What are you talking about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A young man comes in here with a cerebral concussion and they treat him for a broken wrist. That is our case! That is the lawsuit that we are going to bring against this hospital. That is what we have been working toward all this time. And you are confusing the issue! Do you understand me?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Alright, alright. But Christ, Albert, this is a great story. This is my exclusive. And it's also the truth!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a little late for you to start telling the truth, isn't it, Pete?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't just drop this now.   I can't just let it go. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure you can. There's gonna be other stories, other exclusives. Don't worry. We'll take care of you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's right. You're our boy, Peter. You take care of us and we'll take care of you. I promise you, that's going to be a very profitable relationship for all of us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Annie, I know that nothing can heal the wound that you have suffered. But ten million dollars in damages will certainly make your grief more comfortable.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, yes, I could use a few things, Reverend, thank you. I been worried about my clothes for instance. I feel that the presentation of my person should be carefully designed. As a model to black mothers everywhere, I think I should have the right wardrobe. So if you could have Mr. Fox's limousine pick me up in the morning, I could do some shopping.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why certainly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll need some furniture, too. And a new refrigerator. And although I should probably continue to live in that shithole of an apartment at least until after the lawsuit is settled, I would like to start looking now for a co-op in Manhattan -- for me and my son -- something with a view of the river and preferably in a neighborhood that is at least upwardly mobile.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: "CITY LIGHT EXCLUSIVE DID NEGLIGENT HOSPITAL SLAUGHTER LAMB

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think we better talk to this Mrs. Ruskin.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You go to the press. You tell them we're going to question the woman, and if she is the woman who was in the car, she faces possible charges, etcetera, etcetera.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Alright.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And you, Mr. Wise-Guy-Know-It-All- Shitface, you're the one got us into this, you're going to get us out. You go to this broad, you tell her she's in a whole lot of trouble, lay it on. But, but, but
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: if she is willing to cooperate, if she will say what we want her to say, then we will grant her immunity.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go on, go.   What are you waiting for?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well today is her husband's funeral.                     *
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (exploding) I don't care if today is her                             * mother's bar mitzvah, you go talk                        * to her!!!                                                *
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - Rev. 4/18/90              117.          * B262B   INT. HALLWAY - FALLOW                                   B262B Is knocking on a door that has a sign reading "Super- intendant." The door opens. We recognize the workman who was fixing the intercom in Maria's apartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Leach?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I understand you been doing some creative wiring in this building. Peter and Leach continue talking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In less than three minutes, I had what I was looking for. It was more than a story. I had the makings of a book here. A great book. A prize winning effort. All I needed was a big finish. Leach opens the door wide and Fallow steps into the apart- ment. As the door closes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I shipped off a little present to Sherman McCoy's lawyer and I waited for the fireworks... 262C
direction.name: direction

What do you say? 262G    ANGLE TO INCLUDE SHERMAN AND KILLIAN                       262G SHERMAN That's us! That's me! That's Maria! How did you get this? HALLWAY - KRAMER - DAY                                   274 looking from room to room. 275   INT. CRYPTS - MARIA - DAY                                     275   * is trying to embrace Sherman. He remains "hunched" over, trying to stay away from her and keep her hands off his back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sherman.   What's wrong with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then why are you all hunched over? Her hands slide down his back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maria, we have to talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sherman, what's this on your back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My what? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 275   CONTINUED:                                                      275 MARIA This lump, this piece of metal, this thing on your back?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know -- my belt, belt buckle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have a belt buckle in the back. There's some sort of subterfuge afoot here. Isn't there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be silly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are secreting something on your body!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maria...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to see what it is. She rips open his shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maria, are you crazy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And a wire!    A wire! She pulls the wire. Sherman yelps in pain. As he spins around, Maria grabs the tapedeck and pulls it off his back. More pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eeeooowww!!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You rotten, dishonest bastard!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maria, I didn't want to do this, but you gave me no choice. A KNOCK at the door.       They freeze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Ruskin. (CONTINUED) )R(   BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 5/8/90                   124. 275   CONTINUED:    (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go away whoever you are!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Jed Kramer. From the                            * district attorney's office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My, my, my, Mr. McCoy. I'd say your goose was just about home- fried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have protected you, Maria. I have been a gentleman. I have done my best to keep your name out of this. But you have got to help me. You have got to do the right thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never. Never. Never. I hope you die and hang in the electric chair! Sherman heads out the back door. 276   INT. HALLWAY - KRAMER - DAY                                    276 KRAMER ... I'm with the District Attorney's office. I wonder if I might have a few words... The door flies open...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's gone!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He just ran out that back door. 277   INT. LIVING ROOM - KRAMER - DAY                                277 runs in, not sure what he's doing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sherman McCoy! (CONTINUED) )R(   BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 5/8/90                      125. 277   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry if I alarmed you.    But he was acting very strange.    My name is Maria Ruskin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kramer, Jed Kramer, Jed. I'm                               * the Assistant District Attorney for Bronx County.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. I see. And what a handsome District Attorney you are, too. Kramer is smitten.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not the... uh... I'm the Assistant D.A.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you and I have a lot to talk about. Don't we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, we do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Because if I'm going to testify I'm going to want to know exactly what I should... and should not say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, ma'am.
direction.name: direction

Sherman has a tape recorder in front of him. In his hand he holds two tapes. There is a KNOCK at the door. 279   ANGLE - FRONT DOOR                                                279 as Sherman opens it.       Sherman's father is standing there. (CONTINUED) )Y(   BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 7/19/90                 126. 279   CONTINUED:                                                    279 MR. McCOY Ah. They weren't sure downstairs whether or not you were here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I usually come in the back way now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see.   May I...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.   Sure.   Sorry. Come in. FOLLOW them INTO... 280   INT. LIVING ROOM - DAY                                        280 MR. McCOY (looking around) It's all gone. Everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.   Judy... uh...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's gone, too?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She moves quickly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She has a good lawyer. *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not sure I ever really liked her. Your wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.       Of course not. Jesus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or this apartment for that matter. For what it cost, for what you paid for it. Or the furniture... (CONTINUED) )Y(   BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 7/19/90                   127. 280   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or my car, or my work, or my clothes, my life, my money... For Christ's sake, you didn't come here now, you didn't come all the way here on a fucking subway probably to tell me now...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.   I didn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean, I'm not going to get, at this late date, I'm not going to get the ethics and morality speech, not now, when I have to                          * do what I'm going to do in that                          * courtroom tomorrow, if that's what                       * you've come to give me, Jesus...                         *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. No. I'm sorry. I came here to... I don't know how to do this. You didn't call. We wanted to help. I came here to tell you that we are here for you. That you are our son and that we love you. 'We.' I don't mean we. I mean I. That I love you. That's all. Mr. McCoy offers his hand in a handshake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please. Sherman takes his hand. Mr. McCoy puts his arm around him and hugs him awkwardly but effectively. They separate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well.   What you want to do?                             *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's only one thing I can do.                         * I want to see the truth come out                         * and burn every one of them. And                          * there's only one way to do that.                         * (CONTINUED) )Y(   BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 7/19/90                   128.         * 280   CONTINUED:     (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you know I have always been a great believer in the truth. I've lived my life as honestly as I know how. I believe in the truth as an essential companion to a man of conscience, a beacon in the vast and dark wasteland of our modern world. And yet...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And yet, if the truth won't set you free, yes. Why not? Lie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 281   INT. COURTROOM - JUDGE WHITE - DAY                              281 is banging his gavel, trying to silence the overflowing courtroom. 282   ANGLE - STATUE OF BLIND JUSTICE                                 282 Some demonstrators are climbing on the statue to get a better view. 283   ANGLE - MARIA                                                   283 On the stand as Kramer questions her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... And this incident occurred on the ramp to the expressway or on the avenue itself. (CONTINUED) BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 4/18/90                  129. 283   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why, on the avenue.    Right on the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And was there any obstruction or barricade of any kind that caused the car to stop?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no.    Nothing like that at all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finally, one last question. Can you tell us, Mrs. Ruskin, who was driving the car when Henry Lamb was hit?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why, Sherman never let anyone drive his car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sherman McCoy was driving the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yes. A roar goes up from the crowd. 284   VARIOUS ANGLES - EVERYONE                                      284 Sherman and Killian at the defense table. In the audience, Bacon, Fox, Gerald Moore, Weiss and finally Peter Fallow taking notes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And there it was. The end of Sherman McCoy. And it wasn't the                        * ending I was hoping for. He was                         * finished. She might as well have put a gun to his head and pulled the trigger. There was no hope now. The darkness closed in around him. And then I noticed the most peculiar thing. Sherman was smiling. 285   ANGLE TO INCLUDE SHERMAN                                       285 smiling. (CONTINUED) )J(   BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 4/25/90                        130. 285   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and I wanted to report the incident but he wouldn't let me. He said he was driving and it was his decision to make.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were surprised?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was shocked. There are certain qualities of virtue that I admire in a human being, virtues that I hope I possess myself... Suddenly, Maria's RECORDED VOICE BLASTS into the courtroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have time for a quickie.    What do you say, Sherman?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't feel terrifically sexy at the moment. White bangs his gavel. Everyone is looking around for                      * the source of the sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What in hell...?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know I'm a sucker for a soft dick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maria, you are incorrigible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Am I? The court goes crazy. White regains order.           Sudden                * silence in time for everyone to hear...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I supppose, we could still go to the police. We could get a very talented lawyer... (CONTINUED) )J(   BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 4/25/90                   131. 285   CONTINUED:    (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And put our heads right into the tiger's mouth? I'm the one who was driving the car. Don't you think I'm the one who should make that decision. Absolute pandemonium. Fallow starts to laugh. Kramer pulls Sherman's briefcase off a chair revealing a hidden tape recorder. He bangs and kicks the recorder, trying to make it stop. Maria faints on the stand. Killian is amazed and amused. He looks at Sherman. Sherman smiles. Killian takes the tape from the recorder. 286   ANGLE - KILLIAN, KRAMER AND SHERMAN                             286 approach the bench.    The courtroom grows more quiet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whose tape is this, Mr. McCoy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That tape is mine, sir. Killian is shocked.    They continue speaking in whispers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If Your Honor please...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up, Mr. Kramer. Mr. McCoy, I remind you that you are still under oath. Now, did you record this conversation?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yes, sir, I did. I recorded this conversation on this tape. My tape. This is my tape of my conversation. I recorded it. Yes, sir. Yes, sir, three bags full.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get out of my face. All of you. Sherman, Killian and Kramer return to their seats. The court starts screaming again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want some fucking order in here! (CONTINUED) )J(   BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 4/25/90                132. 286   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He bangs the gavel until the noise subsides.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you insist on testing the will of this court!!!! Now you shut up and sit down!! All of you! Very well. In the case of the People versus Sherman McCoy, the Grand Jury has returned an indictment. Based on the evidence contained in this recording... (holds up the tape) ... and pursuant to my authority to supervise the Grand Jury's proceedings...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whitewash!! Whitewash!! (CONTINUED) )J(   BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 4/25/90                   133. 286   CONTINUED:    (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I am ordering the indictment dismissed in the interests of justice, without prejudice and with leave to re-present by the District Attorney. The courtroom explodes.    Screams fill the air -- "Racist! Peckerwood! Pussyface!     Motherfucker!" etc. The sound is deafening. Sherman and Killian shake hands. The demonstrators are chanting, "Justice! Justice! Justice!" 287   ANGLE - DOORS OF COURTROOM                                      287 burst open.    Reporters and photographers rush into the room. 288   ANGLE - WHITE                                                   288   * rises on the bench like an eagle.    He pounds the gavel repeatedly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Justice. We want justice!!!   We want justice!!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Justice! You want justice?!   I'll give you justice! Finally, the courtroom goes quiet. White looks around.                * Everyone is quiet. And then a single VOICE rings out...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You racist pig!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You dare call me a racist! Well, I say to you, you -- a mob who dares to come into these walls -- I say to you, what does it matter ... the color of a man's skin? If witnesses perjure themselves... and a prosecutor, a sworn officer of the court, enlists the perjurers ... and a district attorney throws a man to the mob and lawyers carve up that man for his money... and men of the cloth, men of God take the prime cuts! Now you tell me -- IS THAT JUSTICE?! Silence. (CONTINUED) )S(   BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 5/18/90                134. 288   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't hear you! More silence.    He comes down off the bench, facing the mob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll tell you what justice is not. Justice is not the will of the few and it's not the will of the many. Justice is not politics. Justice is the law. And the law is man's feeble attempt to set down the principles of decency. Decency! And decency is not a deal. Or an angle, or a contract, or a hustle or a campaign or a trick or a bid for sympathy. Decency is not the beast that bays for money, power, dominion, position, votes and blood! Decency is what your mother taught you! Decency is in your bones! Do I make myself clear! Now go home. Go home now. Be decent people. Be decent. A moment of quiet as White comes down and faces Sherman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're free to go, Mr. McCoy. 289   ANGLE - COURTROOM                                            289 as another blood-curdling roar goes up from the crazed mob. They close in on the Judge and Sherman. 290   ANGLE - REVEREND BACON                                       290 with a bullhorn, egging on the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bald-headed Uncle Tom pussy!!                     * (to the crowd)                                 * Are you going to take this Park                       * Avenue justice!? Are you?                             * 291   OMITTED                                                      291   * 292   ANGLE - CROWD                                                292 closing in on Sherman and the Judge. The Judge grabs               * Sherman and pulls him through the door.                            * )S(    BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 5/18/90               135.          * 292A   INT. CORRIDOR - SHERMAN AND JUDGE                           292A come out of the courtroom, pursued by the spectators. They are pressed against a huge statue of "blind justice" at the end of the corridor. 292B   SEVERAL ANGLES - MOBS OF PEOPLE                             292B rushing at Sherman and the Judge from different sides. 292C   ANGLE - STATUE                                              292C teeters. 292D   ANGLE - KRAMER                                              292D in the mob, pressing toward Sherman and the Judge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not finished with you, McCoy. You'll be back in this courtroom. This decision will be appealed until I see you behind bars! You hear me, Judge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get your fucking face out of my way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This fucking face is going to see you shining shoes in Grand Central Station. More pushing until... 293    OMITTED                                                     293 &                                                                  & 294
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: falls. People scream and scatter. The statue shatters as it hits the floor. The bronze sword slides across the floor and comes to rest at Sherman's feet. 296    ANGLE - SCENE                                               296 The Judge is hit on the head by some debris. He stumbles, blinded by the plaster dust. Sherman grabs the sword.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This fucking face is going to see you selling pencils, you black son of a bitch. (CONTINUED) )S(    BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 5/18/90                 135A.      * 296    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sherman whacks Kramer with the sword. Kramer falls away. Sherman helps the Judge down the corridor. 296A   ANGLE - BACON AND FOX                                      296A coming out of the courtroom, intercepting Sherman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sherman whacks Bacon. The choir women start to wail. Fox approaches Sherman offering his card.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sherman whacks Fox with the sword and continues down the corridor with the Judge. 296B   ANGLE - WEISS                                              296B giving an interview for a TV news team.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weiss sees Sherman and attacks him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sherman smacks Weiss with the sword and moves toward the stairs with the Judge. 297    OMITTED                                                    297 297A   ANGLE - FALLOW                                             297A approaches Sherman. (CONTINUED) )S(    BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 5/18/90                 136.          * 297A   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sherman! Sherman! Congratulations. This is going to make one hell of a story!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Peter Fallow. Ha. Ha. Ha. Sherman looks at him for a moment. Then he lets out a screaming war cry and smacks Fallow with the sword. 297B   ANGLE - FALLOW                                                297B falls to the ground.      He looks up.    He smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: move down the stairs and out the iron gates of the court- house. 298A   EXT. COURTHOUSE - SHERMAN - DAY                               298A pulls the gates shut and slides the sword through the door handles, locking the crowd inside the courthouse. They pound on the gates as the courtroom guards try to hold them back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He walks up to the iron gates. The faces of the demon- strators are pressed against it. The Judge shakes a tired fist at them. Then he turns to Sherman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Judge shakes his fist at Sherman, too. Then he opens the fist and offers his hand to Sherman. Sherman takes it. They shake. )S(    BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 5/18/90                137.          * 299    ANGLE - PETER FALLOW                                         299 through the iron gates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was the last I saw of Sherman McCoy... 300    ANGLE - SCENE                                                300 Sherman turns and walks away down the corridors of justice. The Judge watches him go. Sherman disappears into a great whiteness as we hear:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And so we come to the end of our story. Sherman, you see, who started with so much, lost everything. But he gained his soul. Whereas I, you see, who started with so little, gained everything...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (on tape)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (on tape) I suppose we could still go to the police. We could get a very talented lawyer...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (on tape) And put our heads right into the horse's mouth? I'm the one who was driving the car. Don't you think I'm the one who should make the decision? And I say, no. No, Sherman. Trust me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You mean the apartment was wired                           *
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: bugged -- all that time?                                *
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah.   I checked it all out.                              * Whoever  sent me this tape is                              * either  a big fan of yours or a not                        * so big  fan of Maria Ruskin.                               *
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then we have this as evidence.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. It's an illegal
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you mean, 'my tape'?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, if you were wired and you recorded your own conversation that would be okay. But there is no way that this tape can be used as evidence in a court of law.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then what good is it? (CONTINUED) )R(    BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 5/8/90                     119. 262G   CONTINUED:    (2)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It gave me an idea.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: An idea about what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: An idea about what to wear when you go to this funeral.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What funeral? 263    OMITTED                                                          263 264    EXT. FUNERAL PARLOR (MADISON AVENUE) - DAY                       264
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sherman!   Whatever are you doing here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry, Maria. I have to talk to you. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You seem to be doing all your talking to the newspapers these days.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Believe me, I had nothing to do with that. We didn't want your name in the papers any more than you did.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I see. Well, here we are, Sherman. The couple that all New York is talking about. And we're not even a couple anymore. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I thought you'd run out  on me. I didn't even know where  you went. And I was left sort of  holding the bag, trying to protect  you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, Sherman. Would I do that to you? Sherman, Sherman, Sherman.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are we going to do with you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have to help me, Maria.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But how can I help you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I know this may sound like a strange request, but you could start by telling the police what really happened.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, Sherman, you are the sweetest thing. But I'm not sure anybody knows what really happened. Not anymore. And if anybody does know, it certainly isn't me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But you were driving the car that night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Was I? I don't remember. Isn't it funny how a little thing like that can slip your mind? (she kisses him) God, there's something about funerals that is so stimulating. My panties have been wet all morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maria, please...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (whispering)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . McCOY
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (on tape)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (on tape)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (on tape)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (on tape)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (on tape)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: * (screaming)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (scream)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (taunting the Judge)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sherman McCoy! You shall not escape. You shall live in fear on this island, in the mighty sea of people, for the people -- and justice -- are waiting for you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You've been woefully misrepresented here, Mr. McCoy. I think you should give me a call...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... and I promise you and the people of this city that Henry Lamb will not be forgotten. Henry Lamb will live, like the Alamo, as a symbol of slaughtered innocence.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And this man's name will live in infamy. Like Adolf Hitler! Like Son of Sam! Like Idi Amin! John Wilkes Booth! Ted Bundy! Jesse Helms!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You again!   Who are you?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, sorry. I'm Peter Fallow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks.   I needed that. 298    ANGLE - SHERMAN AND JUDGE                                     298
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you alright?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm alright.   Damn hooligans.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And you. You, too. You go home now. And be decent. You hear me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I hear you, Your Honor.
dialogue.name: dialogue
